title: Introduction to msigdbr
text: Pathway analysis common task genomics research many available R-based software tools. Depending tool, may necessary import pathways, translate genes appropriate species, convert symbols IDs, format resulting object. msigdbr R package provides Molecular Signatures Database (MSigDB) gene sets typically used Gene Set Enrichment Analysis (GSEA) software: R-friendly “tidy” format one gene pair per row multiple frequently studied model organisms, mouse, rat, pig, zebrafish, fly, yeast, addition original human genes gene symbols well NCBI Entrez Ensembl IDs without accessing external resources requiring active internet connection

title: Introduction to msigdbr
text: package can installed CRAN.

title: Introduction to msigdbr
text: Load package. msigdbr() function retrieves data frame genes gene sets database.
code: library(msigdbr) all_gene_sets <- msigdbr() head(all_gene_sets) #> # A tibble: 6 × 20 #>   gene_symbol ncbi_gene ensembl_gene db_gene_symbol db_ncbi_gene db_ensembl_gene #>   <chr>       <chr>     <chr>        <chr>          <chr>        <chr>           #> 1 ABCC4       10257     ENSG0000012… ABCC4          10257        ENSG00000125257 #> 2 ABRAXAS2    23172     ENSG0000016… ABRAXAS2       23172        ENSG00000165660 #> 3 ACTN4       81        ENSG0000013… ACTN4          81           ENSG00000130402 #> 4 ACVR1       90        ENSG0000011… ACVR1          90           ENSG00000115170 #> 5 ADAM9       8754      ENSG0000016… ADAM9          8754         ENSG00000168615 #> 6 ADAMTS5     11096     ENSG0000015… ADAMTS5        11096        ENSG00000154736 #> # ℹ 14 more variables: source_gene <chr>, gs_id <chr>, gs_name <chr>, #> #   gs_collection <chr>, gs_subcollection <chr>, gs_collection_name <chr>, #> #   gs_description <chr>, gs_source_species <chr>, gs_pmid <chr>, #> #   gs_geoid <chr>, gs_exact_source <chr>, gs_url <chr>, db_version <chr>, #> #   db_target_species <chr>

title: Introduction to msigdbr
text: species parameter enables conversion original human genes orthologs various model organisms, mouse. can use msigdbr_species() check available species. Please aware orthologs computationally predicted gene level. full pathways may well conserved across species. human mouse versions MSigDB. db_species parameter specifies database (human default). genes within gene set may originate species different database target species, indicated gs_source_species db_target_species fields.
code: all_gene_sets <- msigdbr(species = "Mus musculus") head(all_gene_sets) #> # A tibble: 6 × 23 #>   gene_symbol ncbi_gene ensembl_gene db_gene_symbol db_ncbi_gene db_ensembl_gene #>   <chr>       <chr>     <chr>        <chr>          <chr>        <chr>           #> 1 Abcc4       239273    ENSMUSG0000… ABCC4          10257        ENSG00000125257 #> 2 Abraxas2    109359    ENSMUSG0000… ABRAXAS2       23172        ENSG00000165660 #> 3 Actn4       60595     ENSMUSG0000… ACTN4          81           ENSG00000130402 #> 4 Acvr1       11477     ENSMUSG0000… ACVR1          90           ENSG00000115170 #> 5 Adam9       11502     ENSMUSG0000… ADAM9          8754         ENSG00000168615 #> 6 Adamts5     23794     ENSMUSG0000… ADAMTS5        11096        ENSG00000154736 #> # ℹ 17 more variables: source_gene <chr>, gs_id <chr>, gs_name <chr>, #> #   gs_collection <chr>, gs_subcollection <chr>, gs_collection_name <chr>, #> #   gs_description <chr>, gs_source_species <chr>, gs_pmid <chr>, #> #   gs_geoid <chr>, gs_exact_source <chr>, gs_url <chr>, db_version <chr>, #> #   db_target_species <chr>, ortholog_taxon_id <int>, ortholog_sources <chr>, #> #   num_ortholog_sources <dbl> all_mm_gene_sets <- msigdbr(db_species = "MM", species = "Mus musculus") head(all_mm_gene_sets) #> # A tibble: 6 × 20 #>   gene_symbol ncbi_gene ensembl_gene db_gene_symbol db_ncbi_gene db_ensembl_gene #>   <chr>       <chr>     <chr>        <chr>          <chr>        <chr>           #> 1 AU021092    239691    ENSMUSG0000… AU021092       239691       ENSMUSG0000005… #> 2 Ahnak       66395     ENSMUSG0000… Ahnak          66395        ENSMUSG0000006… #> 3 Alcam       11658     ENSMUSG0000… Alcam          11658        ENSMUSG0000002… #> 4 Ankrd40     71452     ENSMUSG0000… Ankrd40        71452        ENSMUSG0000002… #> 5 Arid1a      93760     ENSMUSG0000… Arid1a         93760        ENSMUSG0000000… #> 6 Bckdhb      12040     ENSMUSG0000… Bckdhb         12040        ENSMUSG0000003… #> # ℹ 14 more variables: source_gene <chr>, gs_id <chr>, gs_name <chr>, #> #   gs_collection <chr>, gs_subcollection <chr>, gs_collection_name <chr>, #> #   gs_description <chr>, gs_source_species <chr>, gs_pmid <chr>, #> #   gs_geoid <chr>, gs_exact_source <chr>, gs_url <chr>, db_version <chr>, #> #   db_target_species <chr>

title: Introduction to msigdbr
text: can retrieve data just specific collection, Hallmark gene sets. can specify sub-collection, C2 (curated) CGP (chemical genetic perturbations) gene sets. require precise filtering, msigdbr() function output data frame can manipulated using standard methods. example, can subset specific collection using dplyr.
code: h_gene_sets <- msigdbr(species = "mouse", collection = "H") cgp_gene_sets <- msigdbr(species = "mouse", collection = "C2", subcollection = "CGP") dplyr::filter(all_gene_sets, gs_collection == "H")

title: Introduction to msigdbr
text: msigdbr() function returns data frame one gene per row. Generally, gene_symbol (gene symbol) gs_name (gene set name) columns useful. data frame contains following columns gene-level info: gene_symbol Official gene symbol requested species. ncbi_gene NCBI (formerly Entrez) ID requested species. ensembl_gene Ensembl ID requested species. db_gene_symbol Official gene symbol MSigDB database. db_ncbi_gene NCBI ID MSigDB database. db_ensembl_gene Ensembl ID MSigDB database. source_gene Gene identifier original publication. ortholog_taxon_id taxon ID species. ortholog_sources databases support ortholog mapping. num_ortholog_sources number databases support ortholog mapping. gs_* columns provide details gene sets: gs_id Gene set systematic name. gs_name Gene set standard name. gs_collection collection gene set belongs . gs_subcollection sub-collection gene set belongs . gs_collection_name name collection. gs_description description gene set. gs_source_species species gene set originated . gs_pmid PubMed ID. gs_geoid GEO ID. gs_exact_source original source gene set, resource identifier, figure, supplementary document publication. gs_url URL original source gene set. db_* columns provide details MSigDB database identical entire data frame: db_version version MSigDB database. db_target_species target species MSigDB database (HS MM).

title: Introduction to msigdbr
text: helper functions assist setting msigdbr() parameters. Use msigdbr_species() check available species. scientific common names acceptable msigdbr() function. Use msigdbr_collections() check available collections.
code: msigdbr_species() #> # A tibble: 20 × 2 #>    species_name                    species_common_name                           #>    <chr>                           <chr> Caenorhabditis elegans          NA                                            #>  4 Canis lupus familiaris          dog, dogs                                     #>  5 Danio rerio                     leopard danio, zebra danio, zebra fish, zebr… #>  6 Drosophila melanogaster         fruit fly                                     #>  7 Equus caballus                  domestic horse, equine, horse short-tailed opossum                     #> 13 Mus musculus                    house mouse, mouse                            #> 14 Ornithorhynchus anatinus        duck-billed platypus, duckbill platypus, pla… #> 15 Pan troglodytes                 chimpanzee                                    #> 16 Rattus norvegicus               brown rat, Norway rat, rat, rats              #> 17 Saccharomyces cerevisiae        baker's yeast, brewer's yeast, S. cerevisiae  #> 18 Schizosaccharomyces pombe 972h- NA                                            #> 19 Sus scrofa                      pig, pigs, swine, wild boar                   #> 20 Xenopus tropicalis              tropical clawed frog, western clawed frog msigdbr_collections() #> # A tibble: 25 × 4 #>    gs_collection gs_subcollection  gs_collection_name               num_genesets #>    <chr>         <chr>             <chr>                                   <int> #>  1 C1            ""                "Positional" #>  4 C2            "CP:BIOCARTA"     "BioCarta Pathways"                       292 #>  5 C2            "CP:KEGG_LEGACY"  "KEGG Legacy Pathways"                    186 #>  6 C2            "CP:KEGG_MEDICUS" "KEGG Medicus Pathways"                   658 #>  7 C2            "CP:PID"          "PID Pathways"                            196 #>  8 C2            "CP:REACTOME"     "Reactome Pathways"                      1787 #>  9 C2            "CP:WIKIPATHWAYS" "WikiPathways"                            885 #> 10 C3            "MIR:MIRDB"       "miRDB" "TFT:TFT_LEGACY"  "TFT_Legacy"                              610 #> 14 C4            "3CA"             "Curated Cancer Cell Atlas gene…          148 #> 15 C4            "CGN"             "Cancer Gene Neighborhoods"               427 #> 16 C4            "CM"              "Cancer Modules"                          431 #> 17 C5            "GO:BP"           "GO Biological Process"                  7583 title: Introduction to msigdbr
text: msigdbr output can used various pathway analysis packages. Use gene sets data frame clusterProfiler genes NCBI/Entrez IDs. Use gene sets data frame clusterProfiler genes gene symbols. Use gene sets data frame fgsea. Use gene sets data frame GSVA. Earlier versions GSVA (<1.50) need gsva() function.
code: msigdbr_t2g <- dplyr::distinct(msigdbr_df, gs_name, ncbi_gene) enricher(gene = gene_ids_vector, TERM2GENE = msigdbr_t2g, ...) msigdbr_t2g <- dplyr::distinct(msigdbr_df, gs_name, gene_symbol) enricher(gene = gene_symbols_vector, TERM2GENE = msigdbr_t2g, ...) msigdbr_list <- split(x = msigdbr_df$gene_symbol, f = msigdbr_df$gs_name) fgsea(pathways = msigdbr_list, ...) msigdbr_list <- split(x = msigdbr_df$gene_symbol, f = msigdbr_df$gs_name) gsvapar <- gsvaParam(geneSets = msigdbr_list, ...) gsva(gsvapar) msigdbr_list <- split(x = msigdbr_df$gene_symbol, f = msigdbr_df$gs_name) gsva(gset.idx.list = msigdbr_list, ...)

title: Introduction to msigdbr
text: version MSigDB used? MSigDB version included returned data frame. Check version unique(msigdbr_df$db_version). use package can download gene sets directly MSigDB? package makes convenient work MSigDB gene sets R. don’t need import GMT files restructure content make compatible downstream tools. adds Ensembl gene IDs converts gene symbols/IDs working non-human data. Can convert human mouse genes simply adjusting gene capitalization? work , , genes. Since 2022, GSEA/MSigDB team provides collections natively mouse don’t require orthology conversion. Can convert genes organism ? One popular method using biomaRt package. may still end dozens homologs genes, additional cleanup may helpful. biomaRt relies live BioMart services, can disrupted server outage maintenance. Aren’t already similar tools? resources provide msigdbr functionality served inspiration package. EGSEAdata Bioconductor package provides data list. WEHI MSigDB provides data human mouse RDS files. MSigDF provides data R data frame. updated varying frequencies may based latest version MSigDB. questions? Please post questions feedback GitHub Discussions. Report bugs GitHub Issues.

title: Introduction to msigdbr
text: Molecular Signatures Database (MSigDB) collection gene sets originally created use Gene Set Enrichment Analysis (GSEA) software. cite use underlying MSigDB data, reference Subramanian, Tamayo, et al. (2005, PNAS) one following appropriate: Liberzon, et al. (2011, Bioinformatics), Liberzon, et al. (2015, Cell Systems), Castanza, et al. (2023, Nature Methods) also source gene set. Gene homologs mapped using babelgene package. information sourced HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee European Bioinformatics Institute integrates orthology assertions predicted eggNOG, Ensembl Compara, HGNC, HomoloGene, Inparanoid, NCBI Gene Orthology, OMA, OrthoDB, OrthoMCL, Panther, PhylomeDB, TreeFam ZFIN. human equivalent within species, ortholog supported largest number databases used. information cite msigdbr R package, run citation("msigdbr").

title: Authors and Citation
text: Igor Dolgalev. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Dolgalev (2025). msigdbr: MSigDB Gene Sets Multiple Organisms Tidy Data Format. R package version 25.1.0.9000, https://igordot.github.io/msigdbr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {msigdbr: MSigDB Gene Sets for Multiple Organisms in a Tidy Data Format},   author = {Igor Dolgalev},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 25.1.0.9000},   url = {https://igordot.github.io/msigdbr/}, }

title: MSigDB gene sets R package
text: msigdbr package provides Molecular Signatures Database (MSigDB) gene sets tidy R data frame. data can accessed using msigdbr() function, returns data frame gene sets member genes. can convert original human genes orthologs organisms, mouse. can retrieve gene sets specific collection, Hallmark gene sets. Check full overview information.
code: genesets <- msigdbr() genesets <- msigdbr(species = "mouse") genesets <- msigdbr(species = "mouse", collection = "H")

what: msigdbr: MSigDB Gene Sets for Multiple Organisms in a Tidy Data Format — msigdbr-package
title: msigdbr: MSigDB Gene Sets for Multiple Organisms in a Tidy Data Format — msigdbr-package
text: Provides 'Molecular Signatures Database' (MSigDB) gene sets typically used 'Gene Set Enrichment Analysis' (GSEA) software (Subramanian et al. 2005 doi:10.1073/pnas.0506580102 , Liberzon et al. 2015 doi:10.1016/j.cels.2015.12.004 , Castanza et al. 2023 doi:10.1038/s41592-023-02014-7 ) R data frame. package includes human genes listed MSigDB well corresponding symbols IDs frequently studied model organisms mouse, rat, pig, fly, yeast.

title: msigdbr: MSigDB Gene Sets for Multiple Organisms in a Tidy Data Format — msigdbr-package
text: Maintainer: Igor Dolgalev igor.dolgalev@nyumc.org (ORCID)

what: Retrieve the gene sets data frame — msigdbr
title: Retrieve the gene sets data frame — msigdbr
text: Retrieve data frame gene sets member genes. original human genes can converted corresponding counterparts various model organisms, including mouse, rat, pig, zebrafish, fly, yeast. output includes gene symbols along NCBI Ensembl IDs.

title: Retrieve the gene sets data frame — msigdbr
code: msigdbr(   db_species = "HS",   species = "human",   collection = NULL,   subcollection = NULL,   category = deprecated(),   subcategory = deprecated() )

title: Retrieve the gene sets data frame — msigdbr
text: db_species Species abbreviation human mouse databases ("HS" "MM"). species Species name output genes, "Homo sapiens" "Mus musculus". scientific common names acceptable. Use msigdbr_species() see available options. collection Collection abbreviation, "H" "C1". Use msigdbr_collections() see available options. subcollection Sub-collection abbreviation, "CGP" "BP". Use msigdbr_collections() available options. category use collection argument subcategory use subcollection argument

title: Retrieve the gene sets data frame — msigdbr
text: tibble (data frame class tibble::tbl_df) gene sets one gene per row.

title: Retrieve the gene sets data frame — msigdbr
text: Historically, MSigDB resource tailored analysis human-specific datasets, gene sets exclusively aligned human genome. Starting release 2022.1, MSigDB incorporated database mouse-native gene sets split human mouse divisions ("Hs" "Mm"). one provided approved gene symbols respective species. Mouse MSigDB includes gene sets curated mouse-centric datasets specified native mouse gene identifiers, eliminating need ortholog mapping.

title: Retrieve the gene sets data frame — msigdbr
text: https://www.gsea-msigdb.org/gsea/msigdb/index.jsp

title: Retrieve the gene sets data frame — msigdbr

title: msigdbr 25.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-07-03 Included MSigDB v2025.1 data.

title: msigdbr 24.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-05-13 Updated package download data, removing non-CRAN msigdbdf data package dependency. Included MSigDB v2024.1 data. Updated package versioning scheme tied MSigDB release.

title: msigdbr 10.0.2
text: CRAN release: 2025-04-14 Updated tests.

title: msigdbr 10.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2025-03-19 Updated documentation.

title: msigdbr 10.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-03-12 Removed MSigDB data (now separate package msigdbdf). Updated package versioning scheme tied MSigDB release. Added support mouse versions MSigDB (msigdbr() gains db_species argument). Updated annotation fields returned gene sets. Updated msigdbr() arguments gs_cat gs_subcat gs_collection gs_subcollection.

text: Based MSigDB v2023.1.Hs release. available CRAN.

title: msigdbr 7.1.1
